content:
To host a Laravel project on your server, you will also need to configure your Laravel project to use the database you created earlier. This can be done by modifying the `.env` file in your project's root directory.

The `.env` file contains the configuration settings for your Laravel project, including the database connection settings. You will need to modify the `DB_DATABASE`, `DB_USERNAME`, and `DB_PASSWORD` settings to match the database you created earlier. For example:
```
DB_DATABASE=laravel
DB_USERNAME=laraveluser
DB_PASSWORD=password
```
Once you have modified the `.env` file, you will need to run the `php artisan migrate` command to run any database migrations and set up the database tables for your Laravel project.

Please note that these are just general instructions for configuring your Laravel project to use a database. The exact steps may vary depending on your specific server environment and the versions of the tools you are using.
